label: history
peekOfCode:
history = []
# Simulation
for date, row in df.iterrows():
    close_price = row['Close']
    fgi_value = row['fgi_value']
    if fgi_value < 60:
        # BUY 10‚Ç¨ worth of BTC
        btc_bought = investment_per_day / close_price
        btc_holdings += btc_bought
        cash -= investment_per_day

peekOfCode:
buy_signals = final_df[final_df['Action'].str.contains('BUY')]
sell_signals = final_df[final_df['Action'].str.contains('SELL')]
plt.scatter(buy_signals.index, buy_signals['Equity'], label='üü¢ Buy', marker='^', color='lime', s=100)
plt.scatter(sell_signals.index, sell_signals['Equity'], label='üî¥ Sell', marker='v', color='red', s=100)
# Decorations
plt.title('Backtest: Invest 10‚Ç¨/day if FGI < 60, Sell 10‚Ç¨/day if FGI >= 60')
plt.xlabel('Date')
plt.ylabel('‚Ç¨ Value')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)

fgi_df.index = pd.to_datetime(fgi_df.index)
# Step 3: Merge BTC data with FGI data
merged = btc_data.join(fgi_df, how='left')
# üî• Detect Close column

if close_column is None:
    raise ValueError("‚ùå Couldn't find a Close column!")
# Keep only Close, fgi_value, fgi_classification
merged = merged[[close_column, 'fgi_value', 'fgi_classification']]
merged = merged.rename(columns={close_column: 'Close'})
